commit_message:
Fix ci

The devstack plugin carries usage of `sudo -u` which doesn't seem to
work in the ci environment.  Replace it with sudo followed by
appropriate permissions changes.
Use ${DEST} instead of literal /opt/stack to fit with gate usage.
Enabled monasca-api plugin in the settings and the required monasca
services along with zookeeper.

Change-Id: I6effede4ac9a2faf1c44eff9cd96bbf9c924d703
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-transform refs/changes/94/402394/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo curl ${MAVEN_REPO}/${SPARK_JAVA_LIB} -o ${SPARK_LIB_NAME} sudo chown spark:spark ${SPARK_LIB_NAME} sudo tar -xzf /opt/spark/download/${SPARK_TARBALL_NAME} -C /opt/spark/ sudo chown -R spark:spark /opt/spark/${SPARK_HADOOP_VERSION} sudo ln -sf /opt/spark/${SPARK_HADOOP_VERSION} /opt/spark/current
deleted_lines: sudo -u spark curl ${MAVEN_REPO}/${SPARK_JAVA_LIB} -o ${SPARK_LIB_NAME} sudo -u spark tar -xzf /opt/spark/download/${SPARK_TARBALL_NAME} -C /opt/spark/ sudo -u spark ln -sf /opt/spark/${SPARK_HADOOP_VERSION} /opt/spark/current

commit_message:
Team upload.

* Team upload.
* Fix tests: Remove obsolete hack for requests 1.2.3 (Closes: #848741)
* d/control: depends requests (>> 1.2.3)

Change-Id: Ie764edbd5f38150f8c0719d54a09fdae405917c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/deb-python-requests-mock refs/changes/56/412856/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Description: Remove obsolete hack for requests 1.2.3 Upstream requests-mock 1.2.0 corrected this issue already. Forwarded: not-needed Author: Ondej Kobliek <koblizeko@gmail.com> --- a/requests_mock/tests/test_mocker.py +++ b/requests_mock/tests/test_mocker.py @@ -14,7 +14,6 @@ import requests import requests_mock -from requests_mock import compat from requests_mock.tests import base original_send = requests.Session.send @@ -56,14 +55,8 @@ def test_real_http(self, real_send, mocker): url = 'http://www.google.com/' - # NOTE(jamielennox): hack for requests 1.2.3 remove after - # requirements catches up. - class FakeHTTPResponse(object): - _original_response = compat._fake_http_response - real_send.return_value = requests.Response() real_send.return_value.status_code = 200 - real_send.return_value.raw = FakeHTTPResponse() requests.get(url) self.assertEqual(1, real_send.call_count)

commit_message:
Addressed proxy issues for maven in vagrant

Change-Id: Ia349bf07cf354cfa2a1efe19b85e918c22c63732
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-transform refs/changes/95/410795/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo Using $http_proxy for the proxy var ACTUAL_PROXY=`echo $TOKEN_STRING | awk 'BEGIN { FS = "//"} ;{ print $2 }'` PROXY_HOST=`echo $ACTUAL_PROXY | awk 'BEGIN { FS = ":"} ;{ print $1 }'` PROXY_PORT=`echo $ACTUAL_PROXY | awk 'BEGIN { FS = ":"} ;{ print $2 }'` sed -i "s/proxy_host/${PROXY_HOST}/g" /home/${USER}/settings.xml sed -i "s/proxy_port/${PROXY_PORT}/g" /home/${USER}/settings.xml cp /home/${USER}/settings.xml /root/.m2/.

subject: fix a syntax error in labels.py

commit_message:
[WIP]Composable upgrades heat-|api|engine|api-cfn|api-cloudwatch

This is a POC for heat services as tracked at
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/tripleo-composable-upgrades

Implements: blueprint overcloud-upgrades-per-service
Change-Id: I9ae4496b1426c8de9daa974349d92d9a53789fa4

commit_message:
Fix bug when using multiple DeployArtifactURLs

The script tries to download all artifact URLs with a single
request, instead of downloading each URL on its own if
multiple DeployArtifactURLs were given.

Closes-Bug: #1649303
Change-Id: I6a8be699aff7023a67702bb1d3ddc2273984cd08
(cherry picked from commit f7e8a043d92bdf759768d9cded62130425af6f64)

subject: Use df instead of findmnt in cephstorage upgrade scripts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-21 20:22:42.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_ceph_storage.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/1ef91874632cb84f273f182e5db890b95afb8949', 'message': 'Use df instead of findmnt in cephstorage upgrade scripts

There are scenarios in which findmnt will return a list of all
mounted filesystems, which causes the upgrade script to fail in
recognizing if the Ceph OSD is backed by ext4.

Change-Id: Iadebdc32b523c05216202b782ceb54bec4389413
Closes-Bug: #1649407
(cherry picked from commit 623c24978294d86513180cf0419536eb30547a2f)
'}]
commit_message:
Use df instead of findmnt in cephstorage upgrade scripts

There are scenarios in which findmnt will return a list of all
mounted filesystems, which causes the upgrade script to fail in
recognizing if the Ceph OSD is backed by ext4.

Change-Id: Iadebdc32b523c05216202b782ceb54bec4389413
Closes-Bug: #1649407
(cherry picked from commit 623c24978294d86513180cf0419536eb30547a2f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/69/413769/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OSD_FS=$(df -l --output=fstype /var/lib/ceph/osd/ceph-${OSD_ID} | tail -n +2)

commit_message:
Bump template version for all templates to "ocata"

Heat now supports release name aliases, so we can replace
the inconsistent mix of date related versions with one consistent
version that aligns with the supported version of heat for this
t-h-t branch.

This should also help new users who sometimes copy/paste old templates
and discover intrinsic functions in the t-h-t docs don't work because
their template version is too old.

Change-Id: Ib415e7290fea27447460baa280291492df197e54
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/55/414555/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: heat_template_version: ocata

commit_message:
Enforce project_safe checking for admin users

Admin users are designed to retrieve objects from all projects even
take actions on them, this will cause a lot problems, for example:
1. name_unique checking issue:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/senlin/+bug/1652742
2. cluster-node-add, admin user can add projectB's node to projectA's
  cluster
Admin users should respect the project concepts as well, this patch
enforces project_safe checking fro admin users. And as for some actions
that admin users should be authorized to retrieve things from all projects,
will be added in following patches.

Change-Id: I7103efabccbb4d10c2572e2df51a38ade009df84

commit_message:
Remove NotificationAction field type

The original design was limiting the actions to be built in action
names. However, when we add new operations (supported by profile types),
this is becoming a restriction.
Considering that this field type is only used internally, we don't need
to apply an unnecessarily restriction here.

Change-Id: I2688d9595e7e22c22150a1c3592df1ac4e62a07e

commit_message:
Clean up stable admonitions

When newton was added to the docs, the necessary css and selector
bits were not added, so the newton admonition doesn't work as
intended right now.  There is also a dangling liberty reference in
the css that can be removed.

Change-Id: Ie906e1c766cc7f537b5ae125c0d4d828085341d0

commit_message:
Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittest2, assertDictEqual() is implemented
by using != operator to compare two dicts. So is assertEqual()
in testtools. assertEqual() in testtools is able to handle dict,
list, set and so on. So we just call assertEqual() to make the
unit tests simpler.

Change-Id: I71508671b5a88640a8f337410566ca2889411c9e

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

To be co-installable with other OpenStack projects and have consistent
testing it's a good idea (tm) to use constraints when creating tox
environments.

Change-Id: I60896968ad441cc38fc54a957936263732b3e751

commit_message:
Fix for VM's not getting IP due to missing SG rules

This patch set fixes missing outbound/inbound rules due
to missing SG rules due to synchronizatin issues while
adding and removing rules seen on a scale environment

Removes sleep calls from networkutils. These calls should
be done outside os-win, if necessary.

Change-Id: I91aec85f00a1e9d1bd51b646521b538695762259
Co-Authored-By: sonu <sonu.sudhakaran@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: ShivaKumar M <shiva.kum.m@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Vinod Kumar <vinod.kumar5@hpe.com>
Closes-Bug: 1591114
(cherry picked from commit 433d1e4027ae9fe973dbdeb1c458349159070ca8)

commit_message:
Adds VLAN trunk mode support

NetworkUtils.set_vswitch_port_vlan_id can now set
VLAN trunks. The method can receive a few new arguments:

* operation_mode: specifies the VLAN operation mode for the
given switch port. Acceptable values: os_win.constants.VLAN_MODE_ACCESS,
os_win.constants.VLAN_MODE_TRUNK. If not given, VLAN_MODE_ACCESS will be
set.
* trunk_vlans: a list of VLAN IDs that will be set in Trunk Mode for the
given switch port. If the given operation_mode is VLAN_MODE_ACCESS, an
AttributeError is raised if a non-None trunk_vlans is given.

Implements: blueprint os-win-vlan-trunks

Change-Id: I0de69f88cc52d8904579e18678e0be8d77bd9a76
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-win refs/changes/64/411364/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from os_win import constants def set_vswitch_port_vlan_id(self, vlan_id=None, switch_port_name=None, **kwargs): """Sets / overrides the operation mode, VLAN ID and VLAN trunk for the given vSwitch port. :param vlan_id: the VLAN ID to be set for the given switch port. :param switch_port_name: the ElementName of the vSwitch port. :param operation_mode: the VLAN operation mode. The acceptable values are: os_win.constants.VLAN_MODE_ACCESS, os_win.constants.VLAN_TRUNK_MODE If not given, VLAN_MODE_ACCESS is used by default. :param trunk_vlans: an array of VLAN IDs to be set in trunk mode. :raises AttributeError: if an unsupported operation_mode is given, or the given operation mode is VLAN_MODE_ACCESS and the given trunk_vlans is not None. """ operation_mode = kwargs.get('operation_mode', constants.VLAN_MODE_ACCESS) trunk_vlans = kwargs.get('trunk_vlans') if operation_mode not in [constants.VLAN_MODE_ACCESS, constants.VLAN_MODE_TRUNK]: raise AttributeError(_('Unsupported VLAN operation mode: %s' % operation_mode)) if operation_mode == constants.VLAN_MODE_ACCESS: if trunk_vlans is not None: raise AttributeError(_('The given operation mode is ACCESS, ' 'set given trunk_vlans.')) if operation_mode == constants.VLAN_MODE_ACCESS: new_vlan_settings = self._prepare_vlan_sd_access_mode( vlan_settings, vlan_id) else: new_vlan_settings = self._prepare_vlan_sd_trunk_mode( vlan_settings, vlan_id, trunk_vlans) if not new_vlan_settings: # if no object was returned, it means that the VLAN Setting Data # was already added with the desired attributes. return # Removing the feature because it cannot be modified # due to a wmi exception. self._jobutils.remove_virt_feature(vlan_settings) # remove from cache. self._vlan_sds.pop(port_alloc.InstanceID, None) self._jobutils.add_virt_feature(new_vlan_settings, port_alloc) def _prepare_vlan_sd_access_mode(self, vlan_settings, vlan_id): if vlan_settings: # the given vlan_id might be None. vlan_id = vlan_id or vlan_settings.AccessVlanId if (vlan_settings.OperationMode == constants.VLAN_MODE_ACCESS and vlan_settings.AccessVlanId == vlan_id): # VLAN already set to correct value, no need to change it. return None vlan_settings = self._create_default_setting_data( self._PORT_VLAN_SET_DATA) vlan_settings.AccessVlanId = vlan_id vlan_settings.OperationMode = constants.VLAN_MODE_ACCESS return vlan_settings def _prepare_vlan_sd_trunk_mode(self, vlan_settings, vlan_id, trunk_vlans): if vlan_settings: # the given vlan_id might be None. vlan_id = vlan_id or vlan_settings.NativeVlanId trunk_vlans = trunk_vlans or vlan_settings.TrunkVlanIdArray or [] trunk_vlans = sorted(trunk_vlans) if (vlan_settings.OperationMode == constants.VLAN_MODE_TRUNK and vlan_settings.NativeVlanId == vlan_id and vlan_settings.TrunkVlanIdArray == trunk_vlans): # VLAN already set to correct value, no need to change it. return None vlan_settings = self._create_default_setting_data( self._PORT_VLAN_SET_DATA) vlan_settings.NativeVlanId = vlan_id vlan_settings.TrunkVlanIdArray = trunk_vlans vlan_settings.OperationMode = constants.VLAN_MODE_TRUNK return vlan_settings
deleted_lines: _OPERATION_MODE_ACCESS = 1 def set_vswitch_port_vlan_id(self, vlan_id, switch_port_name): if vlan_settings: if (vlan_settings.OperationMode == self._OPERATION_MODE_ACCESS and vlan_settings.AccessVlanId == vlan_id): # VLAN already set to corect value, no need to change it. return # Removing the feature because it cannot be modified # due to a wmi exception. self._jobutils.remove_virt_feature(vlan_settings) # remove from cache. self._vlan_sds.pop(port_alloc.InstanceID, None) vlan_settings = self._create_default_setting_data( self._PORT_VLAN_SET_DATA) vlan_settings.AccessVlanId = vlan_id vlan_settings.OperationMode = self._OPERATION_MODE_ACCESS self._jobutils.add_virt_feature(vlan_settings, port_alloc)

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove cliff and at the same time pull any required
libraries from git.

Change-Id: Idb9c4a0aa0022cc5b61f9e44ca6c24de9e10ea68

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove os-win.

Change-Id: Idd9640825566eae61aa5776550c12f52c15a0ad1

commit_message:
tox: rename zeromq target

The current zeromq target name are too long and reach the limitation
of 127 chars of the sheband of the virtualenv binary.

A target name must not be more than 22 chars to run in gate with
the tox job template.

This renames them to a shorter one.

It also creates aliases for the legacy jobs that we will remove
when the tox jobs are ready.

Change-Id: I5cbc368e7ea252f8c0c949c8e7ee3a70a560db22
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/71/411171/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(sileht): we have to rename the zmq tox target to shorter name # this is to not break the current dsvm gating system until we switch to the tox one case $1 in zeromq) RPC_BACKEND=zmq;; zeromq-proxy) RPC_BACKEND=zmq-proxy;; zeromq-pub-sub) RPC_BACKEND=zmq-pubsub;; *) RPC_BACKEND=$1;; esac

commit_message:
bug-triagging: add networking tag

Some folks in TripleO are specialized in networking.
It would be useful for them to have a tag in Launchpad that would allow
to classify networking related bugs in TripleO.

Change-Id: I2b73509b3d3fb79cef1852c81c8b25852b88f064

subject: carbonara: log a message and do not fail if a file is missing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-06 17:16:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi/commit/f2b218862870dc165349c874f970c26ba0f26e43', 'message': 'carbonara: log a message and do not fail if a file is missing

When rewriting data for compression, it's possible a file
<metric>_<splitkey>_<aggregation_method>_<granularity> is missing,
because of some data corruption. In that case the following traceback happens:

  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 557, in process_new_measures
      ignore_too_old_timestamps=True)
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/carbonara.py", line 217, in set_values
      before_truncate_callback(self)
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 551, in _map_add_measures
      for aggregation in agg_methods))
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 675, in _map_no_thread
      return list(itertools.starmap(method, list_of_args))
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 316, in _add_measures
      oldest_mutable_timestamp)
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 249, in _store_timeserie_split
      offset, data = split.serialize(key, compressed=write_full)
  AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'serialize'

This patch makes the driver log a warning and return, so it just ignores
the failure and continues anyway.

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-06 18:38:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi/commit/4a1055ec011a351b5bcca10603982a27dde38c7b', 'message': 'carbonara: log a message and do not fail if a file is missing

      ignore_too_old_timestamps=True)
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/carbonara.py", line 217, in set_values
      before_truncate_callback(self)
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 551, in _map_add_measures
      for aggregation in agg_methods))
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 675, in _map_no_thread
      return list(itertools.starmap(method, list_of_args))
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 316, in _add_measures
      oldest_mutable_timestamp)
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 249, in _store_timeserie_split
      offset, data = split.serialize(key, compressed=write_full)

This patch makes the driver log a warning and return, so it just ignores
the failure and continues anyway.

      return list(itertools.starmap(method, list_of_args))
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 316, in _add_measures
      oldest_mutable_timestamp)
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 249, in _store_timeserie_split
      offset, data = split.serialize(key, compressed=write_full)
  AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'serialize'

This patch makes the driver log a warning and return, so it just ignores
the failure and continues anyway.

Change-Id: I4f367b2418c8be0067746c88bcce74ca756acf4e
'}]
commit_message:
carbonara: log a message and do not fail if a file is missing

When rewriting data for compression, it's possible a file
<metric>_<splitkey>_<aggregation_method>_<granularity> is missing,
because of some data corruption. In that case the following traceback happens:

  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 557, in process_new_measures
      ignore_too_old_timestamps=True)
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/carbonara.py", line 217, in set_values
      before_truncate_callback(self)
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 551, in _map_add_measures
      for aggregation in agg_methods))
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 675, in _map_no_thread
      return list(itertools.starmap(method, list_of_args))
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 316, in _add_measures
      oldest_mutable_timestamp)
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 249, in _store_timeserie_split
      offset, data = split.serialize(key, compressed=write_full)
  AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'serialize'

This patch makes the driver log a warning and return, so it just ignores
the failure and continues anyway.

Change-Id: I4f367b2418c8be0067746c88bcce74ca756acf4e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/14/407614/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if split is None: # `split' can be none if existing is None and no split was passed # in order to rewrite and compress the data; in that case, it means # the split key is present and listed, but some aggregation method # or granularity is missing. That means data is corrupted, but it # does not mean we have to fail, we can just do nothing and log a # warning. LOG.warning("No data found for metric %s, granularity %f " "and aggregation method %s (split key %s): " "possible data corruption", metric, archive_policy_def.granularity, aggregation, key) return

commit_message:
Create project rst2bash

Rst2bash will be part of Documentation team and follow an independent
release model. Rst2bash primarily focuses on validating install guides
by parsing the RST to Bash and running the generated bash code using
training-labs for deploying OpenStack cluster. Additionally also
generate OpenStack deployment scripts for training-labs.

Change-Id: Ie38a69fb2a64216122f2a9feffdf35218356453f
Depends-On: Ibbafbaae49279acf2bf63e5cdd19b1f0433f826d

commit_message:
Extend swift-init config handling documentation

Extend Deployment Guide documentation:
 . extend how swift-init uses configuration files to start servers
 . add example starting multiple servers using swift-init
 . add server - configuration file pairing table.

Change-Id: I5181b4723e4408ab21a5a5bd69bfbc4737ad806b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/04/293904/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Tool ``swift-init`` assigns configuration files to daemons based on appearance of the ``{type}-server`` in path to configuration file or directory (with the exception of ``object-expirer`` and ``container-reconciler``, which are expected to have in path ``object-expirer`` and ``container-reconciler`` respectively) and attpempts to start one server per configuration file or directory. For example using following configuration directory:: /etc/swift/ default.base object-server.1.conf.d/ 000_default.conf -> ../default.base 001_default-override.conf 010_server.conf object-server.2.conf object-server/ 3.conf ``swift-init object-auditor start`` starts three object-auditors. Swift init starts servers using config files with following path substrings: ==================== ======================================================== substring servers ==================== ======================================================== account-server account-auditor, account-reaper, account-replicator, account-server container-reconciler container-reconciler container-server container-auditor, container-replicator, container-server, container-sync, container-updater object-expirer object-expirer object-server object-auditor, object-replicator, object-reconstructor, object-server, object-updater proxy-server proxy-server ==================== ========================================================

"The service that provides a set of services for management of shared file " "systems in a multi-tenant cloud environment, similar to how OpenStack " "provides block-based storage management through the OpenStack :term:`Block " "Storage service<Block Storage service (cinder)>` project. With the Shared " "File Systems service, you can create a remote file system and mount the file " "system on your instances. " "       ." msgid ""msgid "The solution addresses the following use cases:" msgstr "     :" msgid "" "To avoid storing the password in plain text, you can prompt for the " "OpenStack password interactively." msgstr "" "     , OpenStack   " "    ." msgid "Unique ID assigned to each project by the Identity service." msgstr "Identity       ID." msgid "Unique ID for a Networking network segment." msgstr "     ID." msgid "User-friendly UI for ad-hoc analytics queries based on Hive or Pig." msgstr "" "Hive  Pig  ad-hoc      UI " "." msgid "" "Users and services can locate other services by using the service catalog, " "which is managed by the Identity service. As the name implies, a service " "catalog is a collection of available services in an OpenStack deployment. " "Each service can have one or many endpoints and each endpoint can be one of " "three types: admin, internal, or public. In a production environment, " "different endpoint types might reside on separate networks exposed to " "different types of users for security reasons. For instance, the public API " "network might be visible from the Internet so customers can manage their " "clouds. The admin API network might be restricted to operators within the " "organization that manages cloud infrastructure. The internal API network " "might be restricted to the hosts that contain OpenStack services. Also, " "OpenStack supports multiple regions for scalability. Together, regions, services, and endpoints created " "within the Identity service comprise the service catalog for a deployment. " "Each OpenStack service in your deployment needs a service entry with " "corresponding endpoints stored in the Identity service. commit_message:
Correct the log path of AMQP

The AMQP info is found in nova-compute.log rather than
nova-compute, this patch fix this.

Change-Id: Iaeed7aa358cffd3793da2b17386392978e601219
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/69/414869/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # grep AMQP /var/log/nova/nova-api.log

commit_message:
move capabilities Functional Test to common directory

Now capabilities FT is located in the 'tests/functional/java' directory.
As the test doesn't depend on storlet language, we move it to
'tests/functional/common directory.

Change-Id: Ifaec0929e4ee282b9e4bbe0b4e50d2515fbcd72a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/storlets refs/changes/12/413512/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Recreate db only if db service is enabled

When setting up additional devstack instances with heat, don't
recreate the database and do db_sync, as it would point to some
existing database.

Change-Id: I65fb33b0ad69bc4e5ff390e2b110779178b957ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/42/396542/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # recreate the db only if mysql is enabled if is_service_enabled mysql; then # (re)create heat database recreate_database heat $HEAT_BIN_DIR/heat-manage db_sync fi

commit_message:
Drop Japanese HA guide

This guide currently does not build and has only 34 % of translated
strings. Remove it from building and remove entry.

Note: Last update to http://docs.openstack.org/draft/ja/ha-guide/ was
2016-09-29.

Change-Id: If53d5d1ede5c01951ca0101fa6b15e682b146b01
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/92/416092/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: ["ja"]="ha-guide image-guide install-guide networking-guide ops-guide user-guide" ["ja"]="ha-guide install-guide networking-guide ops-guide"

commit_message:
Replace oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime

Function 'oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime()' is deprecated in version '1.6'
and will be removed in a future version. We cant't use
datetime.datetime.isoformat() instead. Because the format of the string
generated by isoformat isn't the same as the format of the string
generated by isotime. The string is used in tokens and other public
APIs and we can't change it without potentially breaking clients.

So the workaround is to copy the current implementation from
oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime() to utils.py

For more informations:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.utils/api/timeutils.html#oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime

Change-Id: Ib384ae8130dcc6cbd47a837d11ca171ce02ef29e
Closes-Bug: #1461251

added_lines: return datetime.datetime.isoformat(orig_dt)

How to find unknown options ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The unknown options can be easily found by watching the output of :command:`create_xxx` or :command:`show_xxx` command. commit_message:
Replace directly import of logging with import oslo_log

The oslo.log (logging) configuration library provides standardized
configuration for all openstack projects. It also provides custom
formatters, handlers and support for context specific
logging (like resource id's etc).

In addition, freezer-web-ui should be consistent with freezer in terms
of style commandments, for
more information,see:
https://github.com/openstack/freezer/blob/master/HACKING.rst

Change-Id: I99499c2b16bd7f7fec1be8ebc72f7632994576cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer-web-ui refs/changes/75/392475/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_log import logLOG = log.getLogger(__name__)

commit_message:
Use assertGreater() or assertLess()

assertGreater() or assertLess()
will return nicer error if it fails.
So we use assertGreater() or assertLess()
to replace assertTrue()

Change-Id: Ic90ebbb8f1d3b0c4d8ee8d317a31dd0d85335a5d

commit_message:
[sentinel] Improve options extracting

- allow to use password for redis master (from transport url or matchmaker_redis.password)
- allow to set a master group name as virtual host of transport_url

Change-Id: Idbb44f96ab09439f4e33f0a4c6e06f4c93a4aeae

commit_message:
Add the "has" DB filter

* This filter is needed for search functionality when we don't need
  to rely on full match. Instead, we should be able to find entities
  by inclusion of a value into a specified field.

Change-Id: I2133493e5b79b59994c7ef6b0e50b6ba1e1d37c6

commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should
call 'raise' without any arguments because it shows
the place where an exception occured initially instead
of place where the exception re-raised

Change-Id: I835bf6d508793ec97c94fab8dc1d3e8234b7d063
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-heat refs/changes/63/405763/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: except Exception as e: raise e

commit_message:
Fix BDM JSON-Schema validation

Current BDM JSON-Schema validation doesn't work for invalid device
parameter in 2nd dict, because JSON-Schema definition is wrong.
This patch fixes it.

Co-Authored-By: Zhenyu Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I56348dc2b7abd9526dfbf21305755505765811c5
Closes-Bug: #1651064
(cherry picked from commit a65551ecd09b3116a13d9b6cc833be0c05b716da)

commit_message:
Skip release 0.13.1 for docutils

The 0.13.1 release breaks some documentation jobs when it tries to build
docs with remote images. This has been reported upstream[0]. The version
matches the supported docutils versions for sphinx.

[0] https://sourceforge.net/p/docutils/bugs/301/

Change-Id: I38580a5f765c7bb586dcf2786e91be15a8eba235
(cherry picked from commit 59020ba6b1f1013740157c00ff125bd2d99afc76)

commit_message:
Add filters to client Python APIs

* A number of Mistral REST API endpoints support parameters that
  allow to filter colections. For example, we can pass
  do 'GET /v2/actions?name=in:std.' in a query string and Mistral
  will return only actions containing 'std.' in their name.
  This capability was missing in the client APIs, this patch
  adds corresponding parameters in the APIs for actions,
  workflows, executions (workflow executions) and tasks (task
  executions).

TODO:
- Add required tests

Partially implements: blueprint mistral-client-api-filters
Change-Id: Ic49f58626cf129f9c9399268c3cd12cc93eee039

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded path to networking-calico dir

Devstack scripts use hardcoded relative path to
networking-calico git repository dir, which makes impossible
installation from any other directory except $DEST/devstack.

commit_message:
Fix import ordering in tempest plugins

For some reason the third-party imports were divided into two
separate groups. This commit combines them to follow the convention
established throughout the rest of the project.

Change-Id: Ice1a681938aef96d0d289a83cadc1cde2f12eb1e

commit_message:
(fix gate)Add depends on for test_volume_resize_success_databases

I observed that our gate sometimes reported error test_volume_resize_success_databases[1],
it seems because resize is not completed, but the implementation of
this test, this error does not always occur, I think that depends
on the resize action is completion before test this function.
I've added depends-on  to this function to make sure that waiting
for resize to complete every time and then execute the function.

[1]:http://logs.openstack.org/87/403287/10/check/gate-trove-functional-dsvm-mysql-ubuntu-xenial/3f6e266/console.html#_2016-12-13_23_32_56_023925
Change-Id: I96a8e74495bcdeb71e381862eb0002a46fe62f2e

commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should
call 'raise' without any arguments because it shows
the place where an exception occured initially instead
of place where the exception re-raised

Change-Id: Idb133295e495a02adc1cccc0da7a6e94eb6180d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-api refs/changes/61/405761/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except Exception: raise
deleted_lines: except Exception as e: raise e

commit_message:
Fix condition for disabling old Murano services

In cases, during installation Murano plugin, when Murano from
box is installed and was disabled on UI we also need to disable
old Murano services.
Uses list around changedAny argument, to pass an iterable to it.

Change-Id: I813b0c5a8c5fbe7b2db5affa777caceeae273d6a
Related-Bug: #1631379

Replace func.func_name with func.__name__
Replace exceptions.OSError with OSError and remove "import exceptions"
map() and filter() if a list is needed on Python 3:
Replace map(func, data) with [func(item) for item in data]
Replace filter(lambda obj: test(obj), data) with [obj for obj in data if test(obj)]

commit_message:
For Python 3 Common patterns(2/2)

Modified some common patterns, in order to better support python3.

The following modifications were made:
Replace func.func_name with func.__name__
Replace exceptions.OSError with OSError and remove "import exceptions"
map() and filter() if a list is needed on Python 3:
Replace map(func, data) with [func(item) for item in data]
Replace filter(lambda obj: test(obj), data) with [obj for obj in data if test(obj)]

Change-Id: I868e831799b5ea02e5bf9a66e468aa4d995da21c
Reference:https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3#Common_patterns

commit_message:
For Python 3 Common patterns

Modified some common patterns, in order to better support python3.

The following modifications were made:
Replace "for key in dict.iterkeys()" with "for key in dict"
Replace dict.iteritems() with dict.items()
Replace dict.itervalues() with dict.values()
Replace iterator.next() with next(iterator)
Replace basestring with six.string_types
Replace unicode with six.text_type
Replace (str, unicode) with six.string_types
Replace (int, long) with six.integer_types
Change-Id: Idcba33a3d69a27aad7a69f19c9f5f8ef37297500
Reference:https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3#Common patterns

deleted_lines: for k, v in config.iteritems(): for k, v in config.iteritems():

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

To be co-installable with other OpenStack projects and have consistent
testing it's a good idea (tm) to use constraints when creating tox
environments.

Change-Id: I401b0bc729101f31455ffc90b9915981498cf5b2

commit_message:
Remove dead code and use default value of argparse.

In the 'tool' method, the var 'apply_rule' was tested, and the
method returned if it was true. Then, it was tested again even
though it could only be 'false' (or not be None).
Also, an unused parameter of main() had been removed.

Closes-Bug #1650599
Change-Id: I4b265ef609d4a5fc8128f40359cf8d04ee8cbe28
Signed-off-by: Sami Makki <mail@samimakki.fr>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy refs/changes/86/411986/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _try_rule(key, rule, target, access_data, o) def main(): default=None, tool(args.policy, args.access, args.rule, is_admin) sys.exit(main())
deleted_lines: if apply_rule: if (apply_rule == key): _try_rule(key, rule, target, access_data, o) else: _try_rule(key, rule, target, access_data, o) def main(argv=sys.argv[1:]): apply_rule = args.rule except Exception: apply_rule = None try: tool(args.policy, args.access, apply_rule, is_admin) sys.exit(main(sys.argv[1:]))

commit_message:
Generalize PCI device as Host device

There are some virtual devices are virtualized from physical PCI devices and
have some common characteristics as PCI devices but they may be not real PCI
devices e.g. vGPU, vTPM, vFPGA. If we can generalize PCI devices by
abstracting some common concepts in a top object, we can re-use most of
those exiting PCI code to handle those non-PCI virtual devices. It will be
helpful to make it easier to introduce new devices to OpenStack.

Change-Id: Ibaa9220d7a53eaecdf17cefdcf20ae6d5aee5610
Blueprint: generalize-pci-device
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/10/385810/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Generalize PCI device ========================================== Launchpad Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/generalize-pci-device There are some virtual devices are virtualized from physical PCI devices and have some common characteristics as PCI devices but they may be not real PCI devices e.g. vGPU, vTPM, vFPGA. If we can generalize PCI devices by abstracting some common concepts in a top object, we can re-use most of those exiting PCI code to handle those non-PCI virtual devices. It will be helpful to make it easier to introduce new devices to OpenStack. Problem description =================== There are some virtual devices are virtualized from physical PCI devices but they may be not real PCI devices. It's difficult to reuse the existing PCI code to track such device resources. e.g. there is no real PCI address for the non-PCI devices. If we put such devices as top resources, it's over effort-wasting to develop and maintain new code for each device type and it ignores the fact they are derived from PCI devices and have many PCI similar characteristics. Use Cases --------- This is trying to generalize PCI device as a common host device. In the future it will be easier for OpenStack to support new PCI devices or other host devices including virtual devices inherited from PCI devices by re-using the common code for the abstracted host device. e.g. to introduce vGPU to Nova, we can create an object inheriting from the abstracted the object of host device. Most of the logic can be handled by the existing host device code, only add small code in the new object to process vGPU specific things: vGPU's address and model name. Proposed change =============== The primary changes that needs to be done are as follows: * Define a new top object host_device and move most of the code currently belong to pci_device to this new object. Make the object of pci_device of one type of host_device and only contains some PCI specific contents :: @base.NovaObjectRegistry.register class HostDevice(base.NovaPersistentObject, base.NovaObject): VERSION = '1.0' fields = { 'id': fields.IntegerField(), # dev_type is used to define the type of host devices; # e.g. 'vGPU', 'vTPM', 'PCI', by default as "PCI". # SR-IOV belong to 'PCI'. 'dev_type': fields.PciDeviceTypeField(), # allow different type of devices to have different address # patterns. So that there are more flexibility to define # devices' address. For real PCI, continue to use the existing # PCI address pattern. 'address': fields.StringField(), 'compute_node_id': fields.IntegerField(nullable=True), 'vendor_id': fields.StringField(), 'product_id': fields.StringField(), 'status': fields.PciDeviceStatusField(), 'label': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'instance_uuid': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'request_id': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'extra_info': fields.DictOfStringsField(), 'parent_id': fields.StringField(nullable=True), } * Organize the available host devices (including the real PCI devices) via the resource pool object of HostDevicePool: :: class HostDevicePool(base.NovaObject): # Version 1.0: Initial version VERSION = '1.0' fields = { 'product_id': fields.StringField(), 'vendor_id': fields.StringField(), # We can define different tags to group devices having the same # 'product_id' and 'vendor_id'. Different dev_type # e.g. tags={'vgpu mode': 'Intel GVT-g on Haswell P4700'} 'tags': fields.DictOfNullableStringsField(), # the count of the available host devices who have the same # 'product_id', 'vendor_id' and 'tags'. 'count': fields.IntegerField(), } * define the relationship between devices. Currently we only define one type of relationship: parent<->children. When one device's state changed, it's allowed to handle state change on the related devices: e.g. SR-IOV PF<->VFs; physical GPU <-> virtual GPU. We can extend to support more relationship type per demand in the future. * Change device pass through options in nova conf files: * pci_alias => host_device_alias * pci_passthrough_whitelist => host_device_passthrough_whitelist * Change the keywords using to specify pass through device in instance flavor. * "pci_passthrough:alias" => "host_device_passthrough:alias" * Replace all places referring to common pci with the host device stuffs. * schedule filters: create a new shedule filter named as HostDevicePassthroughFilter to filter host devices basing on the host state and the host device request specs. * compatibility consideration: * In order to back compatible with the existing PCI pass through, will keep the schedule filter of PciPassthroughFilter but need change its code to use the generalized host device code. But may mark this schedule filter as deprecated. * Support both pci* and host_device* in the nova conf files and instance flavor, but mark those "pci*" as deprecated. Alternatives ------------ * Keep current PCI device stuffs and create new top resources for new non-PCI devices (vGPU, vTPM, vFPGA). * Create fake PCI devices for non-PCI devices and re-use the existing PCI code. Data model impact ----------------- * Create a new table for host_devices; * Migrate PCI data from pci_devices to host_devices. REST API impact --------------- TODO Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- Developer impact ---------------- Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Jianghua Wang <jianghua.wang@citrix.com> Other contributors: Bob Ball <bob.ball@citrix.com> Work Items ---------- As described in the 'Proposed change' section. Dependencies ============ Testing ======= * Will develop unit tests for the generalized host device code * CI. Documentation Impact ==================== Add new document for host device pass through in OpenStack admin guide. References ========== * Attaching physical PCI devices to guests: http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/compute-pci-passthrough.html History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Ocata - Introduced

commit_message:
Usage of node (un)assignment handlers

New /api/clusters/:id/assignment and
/api/clusters/:id/unassignment endpoints
are intended to assign/remove cluster nodes
without manual management of
pending_addition, pending_deletion flags.

Also, the new handlers allow to remove a deployed node role
from UI.

Related-Bug: #1642165

Change-Id: I43025e8804713c090ace150020954da643640bf6

deleted_lines: var nodes = new models.Nodes(this.props.nodes.map((node) => { if (node.get('pending_addition')) { return { id: node.id, cluster_id: null, pending_addition: false, pending_roles: [] }; } return { id: node.id, pending_deletion: true }; })); Backbone.sync('update', nodes) .then(() => { return this.props.cluster.get('nodes').fetch(); }) .done(() => { dispatcher.trigger('updateNodeStats networkConfigurationUpdated ' + 'labelsConfigurationUpdated'); this.showError(response, i18n('cluster_page.nodes_tab.node_deletion_error.' + 'node_deletion_warning'));

commit_message:
Add a primary_openstack_network_server_config task

Fuel deploys three controller nodes simultaneously. If the
primary-controller node doesn't execute openstack_network_server_config
task, other controller nodes execute this task, and will fail to start
neutron-server.Because primary-controller node has not populate
neutron-server's database by neutron-db-manage. So add controller's
dependence on primary-controller.

Change-Id: I8c6519dbb1bed6ce418156faf10c4e74c0127a47
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/64/389964/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix '/root/openrc's duplicate declaration

User configures Username(root) and Home directory(/root) in
Operating System Access, and will throw the error that
Credentials_file[/root/openrc] is already declared in deployment.

Change-Id: Ia7f158d5483c350743a2e352191076ade5f8c5f5
Closes-Bug: #1636472
Co-Authored-By: chendengyi <chendy_0598@163.com>

commit_message:
[pep8] Fix E265 problems

test_blazar_filter.py failed E265 (block comment should start with '# ')
fix that.

And remove E265 from the ignores list to prevent this from happening
again.

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

To be co-installable with other OpenStack projects and have consistent
testing it's a good idea (tm) to use constraints when creating tox
environments.

Change-Id: I4eccb636381381174e32feea73c8f722574936d8

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ifbe7929580ec61a2cd50232794c0cbd0cbf37edc

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I6bf760e6f3db50696dc87230c444f9ed493615f0

commit_message:
Ignore prlimit argument on Windows

The built in 'resource' module is used in order to apply process
resource limits. This is not available on Windows.

For the moment, we'll ignore this argument and log a warning
message. In the future, we may provide a portable implementation
for this feature.

Change-Id: I6a82916eb68fbf8737b45a65f71cae1f835d12d1
Closes-Bug: #1627766
(cherry picked from commit 9ac99b675eae255b660b03d3a1e61599d09f8316)

added_lines: @mock.patch.object(os, 'name', 'nt') @mock.patch.object(processutils.subprocess, "Popen") def test_prlimit_windows(self, mock_popen): # We want to ensure that process resource limits are # ignored on Windows, in which case this feature is not # supported. We'll just check the command passed to Popen, # which is expected to be unaltered. prlimit = self.limit_address_space() mock_popen.return_value.communicate.return_value = None processutils.execute( *self.SIMPLE_PROGRAM, prlimit=prlimit, check_exit_code=False) mock_popen.assert_called_once_with( self.SIMPLE_PROGRAM, stdin=mock.ANY, stdout=mock.ANY, stderr=mock.ANY, close_fds=mock.ANY, preexec_fn=mock.ANY, shell=mock.ANY, cwd=mock.ANY, env=mock.ANY)

subject: RBD: prevent creation of encrypted volumes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-22 20:23:26.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_rbd.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/5068e76d7f7e24a601a85d73866a8318d99dc431', 'message': "RBD: prevent creation of encrypted volumes

At the moment RBD volume encryption is not supported.  Libvirt needs
support for non-block encryption and nova will need a few changes as
well.  Efforts are underway to resolve this, but in the mean time it's
very confusing to users when we allow them to create encrypted volumes
using volume types as stated in the documentation.  Encryption of the
volume will eventually fail, but allowing this creation creates an
unreasonable expectation.

This patch prevents encrypted volume creation for RBD until support has
landed.  At that time, this patch should be reverted.

Change-Id: I0f071a4aea2d6454b71d83055e87d87b9efcc014
(cherry picked from commit 4bf72b0aec1370dfc79a2fba683ed74cb87dea11)
(cherry picked from commit 5d0a89cc51c29a783d9ef5df8d44059e356d1ef8)
"}]
commit_message:
RBD: prevent creation of encrypted volumes

At the moment RBD volume encryption is not supported.  Libvirt needs
support for non-block encryption and nova will need a few changes as
well.  Efforts are underway to resolve this, but in the mean time it's
very confusing to users when we allow them to create encrypted volumes
using volume types as stated in the documentation.  Encryption of the
volume will eventually fail, but allowing this creation creates an
unreasonable expectation.

This patch prevents encrypted volume creation for RBD until support has
landed.  At that time, this patch should be reverted.

Change-Id: I0f071a4aea2d6454b71d83055e87d87b9efcc014
(cherry picked from commit 4bf72b0aec1370dfc79a2fba683ed74cb87dea11)
(cherry picked from commit 5d0a89cc51c29a783d9ef5df8d44059e356d1ef8)

commit_message:
Switch to python 3.5

Use trueorfalse to normalize the values for USE_PYTHON3

Install 3.5 instead of 3.4 When USE_PYTHON3 is specified.
Also, since not many packages are classified correctly, fallback
to looking for just "Programming Language :: Python :: 3" and
log a message for the package to highlight the problem.

Also special case some services that are *almost* ready

Depends-On: Id48e1b328230fcdf97ed1cb4b97f4c3f9cf6eb8a
Depends-On: Ib7d9aa0e0b74a936002e0eea0b3af05102b06a62
Change-Id: I243ea4b76f0d5ef57a03b5b0798a05468ee6de9b

commit_message:
placement: change default vhost & port

8778 port was removed from devstack for Nova Placement testing,
it overlaps with OpenStack Senlin.
Instead, we should use /placement vhost.

Note: this change is not backward compatible on purpose, we introduced
the placement service during Ocata cycle.

Change-Id: I74662aa4d6b6179cb8ef759b7d5df82b609aa7cc

Added the token 'encrypted_key' to mask_password list

The name encrypted_key is used in trove and it would be good to mask
it from log output.

commit_message:
Fix openstack networking task dependency

Creation of networks and routers should always
happen after neutron server has been fully configured
on all openstack controllers.

Closes-Bug: #1649627
Change-Id: Idc194b65ba86b6673dcb339acf09e7cca44b6cc9

This patch replaces python standard base64 library call to
oslo_serialization.base64 to follow OpenStack Python3 porting
standard [1], since the requirements.txt has already defined

Change-Id: I1dafe878a71f37d223eaf58ea8e2e8c6b4422a14
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-15 10:36:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/4b7cc9925de1757bb377550e16e57d79d9e11886', 'message': "Use oslo_serialization.base64 to follow OpenStack Python3

This patch replaces python standard base64 library call to
oslo_serialization.base64 to follow OpenStack Python3 porting
standard [1].

Use base64 encoding takes 8-bit binary byte data and encodes it. On
Python3, A string is a sequence of Unicode characters thus base64 has
no idea what to do with Unicode data, it's not 8-bit[2]. We use

commit_message:
Use oslo_serialization.base64 to follow OpenStack Python3

This patch replaces python standard base64 library call to
oslo_serialization.base64 to follow OpenStack Python3 porting
standard [1].

Use base64 encoding takes 8-bit binary byte data and encodes it. On
Python3, A string is a sequence of Unicode characters thus base64 has
no idea what to do with Unicode data, it's not 8-bit[2]. We use
oslo_serialization.base64 for both python2 and python3.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8908287/base64-encoding-in-python-3

Change-Id: I1dafe878a71f37d223eaf58ea8e2e8c6b4422a14
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/31/411131/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_serialization import base64 return base64.encode_as_bytes(fp.getvalue())

to "Infrastructure components" section.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/43/411743/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Installation of the services ---------------------------- Create the log directory:: mkdir /var/log/cloudkitty/ Installation of the client --------------------------- Installation of the dashboard integration ----------------------------------------- Retrieve and install CloudKitty's dashboard:: git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/cloudkitty-dashboard.git cd cloudkitty-dashboard python setup.py install Find where the python packages are installed:: PY_PACKAGES_PATH=`pip --version | cut -d' ' -f4` Then add the enabled file to the horizon settings or installation. Depending on your setup, you might need to add it to ``/usr/share`` or directly in the horizon python package:: # If horizon is installed by packages: ln -sf $PY_PACKAGES_PATH/cloudkittydashboard/enabled/_[0-9]*.py \ /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/openstack_dashboard/enabled/ # Directly from sources: ln -sf $PY_PACKAGES_PATH/cloudkittydashboard/enabled/_[0-9]*.py \ $PY_PACKAGES_PATH/openstack_dashboard/enabled/ Restart the web server hosting Horizon. Then you need to know which keystone API version you use (which can be determine using `openstack endpoint list`) For keystone (identity) API v2 ------------------------------ url = http://localhost:5000/v2.0 Please note that `http://localhost:5000/v2.0`and `http://localhost:35357/v2.0` are your identity enpoints. For keystone (identity) API v3 ------------------------------ The following shows the basic configuration items: .. code-block:: ini [DEFAULT] verbose = True log_dir = /var/log/cloudkitty [oslo_messaging_rabbit] rabbit_userid = openstack rabbit_password = RABBIT_PASSWORD rabbit_hosts = RABBIT_HOST [ks_auth] auth_type=v3password auth_protocol=http auth_url=http://localhost:5000/v3 identity_uri=http://localhost:35357/v3 username=cloudkitty password=CK_PASSWORD project_name=service user_domain_name=default project_domain_name=default debug=true [keystone_authtoken] auth_section=ks_auth [database] connection = mysql://cloudkitty:CK_DBPASS@localhost/cloudkitty [keystone_fetcher] auth_section=ks_auth keystone_version=3 [tenant_fetcher] backend=keystone [collect] collector = ceilometer period = 3600 services = compute, volume, network.bw.in, network.bw.out, network.floating, image [ceilometer_collector] auth_section=ks_auth Please note that `http://localhost:5000/v3`and `http://localhost:35357/v3` are your identity enpoints.If you need to authorize the cloudkitty mysql user from another host you have to change the line accordingly. openstack user create cloudkitty --password CK_PASSWORD --email cloudkitty@localhost openstack service create rating --name cloudKitty \ public http://localhost:8889 openstack endpoint create rating --region RegionOne \ admin http://localhost:8889 openstack endpoint create rating --region RegionOne \ internal http://localhost:8889
deleted_lines: The following shows the basic configuration items: url = http://localhost:5000 openstack user create cloudkitty --password CK_PASS --email cloudkitty@localhost openstack service create rating --name CloudKitty \ --publicurl http://localhost:8889 \ --adminurl http://localhost:8889 \ --internalurl http://localhost:8889Horizon integration from cloudkitty-dashboard source ==================================================== Retrieve and install CloudKitty's dashboard:: git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/cloudkitty-dashboard.git cd cloudkitty-dashboard python setup.py install Find where the python packages are installed:: PY_PACKAGES_PATH=`pip --version | cut -d' ' -f4` Then add the enabled file to the horizon settings or installation. Depending on your setup, you might need to add it to ``/usr/share`` or directly in the horizon python package:: # If horizon is installed by packages: ln -sf $PY_PACKAGES_PATH/cloudkittydashboard/enabled/_[0-9]*.py \ /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/openstack_dashboard/enabled/ # Directly from sources: ln -sf $PY_PACKAGES_PATH/cloudkittydashboard/enabled/_[0-9]*.py \ $PY_PACKAGES_PATH/openstack_dashboard/enabled/ Restart the web server hosting Horizon.

commit_message:
Remove link to modindex

The documentation build does not generate any module index, thus remove
the link to the page. The page
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/reno/py-modindex.html does not
exist.

Change-Id: I79bc9033cfa2edb4eeebb8b65e61f41eb78b7a42

commit_message:
Add scenario test for neutron-dynamic-routing

I plan that scenario tests are run in ocata and later release and
a existing job for api test will be affected by it.
So the job for api test needs to checked whether it runs on stable/newton.

Depends-On: I9923775806b095455ed3723e71410287bdf6cb1e
Change-Id: Ieb710181c1e496742e1e019a6238e5e0bd922971

commit_message:
Log warning if no property for (Un)Set commands

For the OSC baremetal commands that Set or Unset properties of a
chassis or port, a warning is logged if the command is invoked without
any properties being specified. This makes the behaviour similar to
that for the node resource.

Change-Id: I78255924daab12f83ea8221bb7a727726986d2d7

(cherry picked from commit 9ce673803a4bf89606dee6732be1f6f628a98920)

commit_message:
Fix cinder lvm filtering

Augeas supports lvm.conf parsing
only starting from version 1.3, and
in Trusty we have augeas 1.2, so we need
to use file_line to edit global_filter.
This is related only to MOS 9.x and Trusty,
in Xenial we have augeas 1.4.

Change-Id: Ic558882781851d90d62737f38fe2e69801751613
Closes-Bug: #1645624

Fix openstack networking task dependency

Creation of networks and routers should always
happen after neutron server has been fully configured
on all openstack controllers.

commit_message:
Sync debian-sysmaint password

For mysql under debian we should have configured mysql-user debian-sys-maint
for proper logrotate operation, etc. Right now we have desynchronization
between password stored in debian.cnf and in mysql database.

Closes-Bug: 1650283
Change-Id: I55d0a7c44980d7ebbd9606c08bb0a744f265feec
(cherry picked from commit 76637cfa99e3616f48441df45d592c471afc7788)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/67/412467/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $deb_sysmaint_password = $mysql_hash['wsrep_password'] deb_sysmaint_password => $deb_sysmaint_password, if $::osfamily == 'Debian' { mysql_user { 'debian-sys-maint@localhost': ensure => 'present', password_hash => mysql_password($deb_sysmaint_password), provider => 'mysql', require => File['/root/.my.cnf'], } }

commit_message:
Make heat::keystone::domain declaration flexible

Change-Id: I3810a2d2b33af95c0ea5336675c4be380f6765d9
Closes-Bug: 1649522
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/87/414987/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: heat_hash = Noop.hiera_structure 'heat', {} heat_domain_name = Noop.puppet_function 'pick', heat_hash['domain_name'], 'heat' heat_domain_admin = Noop.puppet_function 'pick', heat_hash['domain_admin'], 'heat_admin' heat_domain_password = heat_hash['user_password'] it 'should declare heat::keystone::domain class with correct parameters' do should contain_class('heat::keystone::domain').with( 'domain_name' => heat_domain_name, 'domain_admin' => heat_domain_admin', 'domain_password' => heat_domain_password, 'domain_admin_email' => 'heat_admin@localhost', 'manage_domain' => true, ) end

by upstream patch - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391569

commit_message:
Increase timeout for connecting to neutron

Nova is timing out when connecting to neutron in
Rally tests, so we need to increase the timeout.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 01:12:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-collect-config/commit/77e590ee85c0e5ec5d19cde2e309a63ae5af021c', 'message': "Add support for Zaqar websockets

This patch adds a new zaqar.use_websockets option which if set to True
in the config file will configure the Zaqar collector to use
the websocket transport instead of wsgi. This can be more efficient
where you want to avoid the continuous polling of o-c-c and instead
just listen on the websocket that is subscribed to a queue.

Like other collectors each iteration creates a new socket object. This

the option to re-configure the agent in the future to use other types

the future that would allow o-c-c to avoid re-exec'ing and thus re-use
the same websocket for multiple sets of metadata.

commit_message:
Add support for Zaqar websockets

This patch adds a new zaqar.use_websockets option which if set to True
in the config file will configure the Zaqar collector to use
the websocket transport instead of wsgi. This can be more efficient
where you want to avoid the continuous polling of o-c-c and instead
just listen on the websocket that is subscribed to a queue.

Like other collectors each iteration creates a new socket object. This
allows us to use the normal re-exec logic in o-c-c and thus gives
the option to re-configure the agent in the future to use other types
of collectors. We could (optionally) look into a higher level option in
the future that would allow o-c-c to avoid re-exec'ing and thus re-use
the same websocket for multiple sets of metadata.

Depends-On: Ia2a8deb599252d8308e44d595eb2bf443999aaad
Change-Id: Id5c7ed590df776844b6c7961eb40f89206cd24e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-collect-config refs/changes/86/342486/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from zaqarclient.transport import websocket cfg.BoolOpt('use-websockets', default=False, help='Use the websocket transport to connect to Zaqar.'), zaqarclient=zaqarclient, websocket=websocket): self.websocket = websocket def get_data_wsgi(self, ks): endpoint = ks.service_catalog.url_for( service_type='messaging', endpoint_type='publicURL') logger.debug('Fetching metadata from %s' % endpoint) conf = { 'auth_opts': { 'backend': 'keystone', 'options': { 'os_auth_token': ks.auth_token, 'os_project_id': CONF.zaqar.project_id } } } zaqar = self.zaqarclient.Client(endpoint, conf=conf, version=1.1) queue = zaqar.queue(CONF.zaqar.queue_id) r = six.next(queue.pop()) return r.body def get_data_websocket(self, ks): endpoint = ks.service_catalog.url_for( service_type='messaging-websocket', endpoint_type='publicURL') logger.debug('Fetching metadata from %s' % endpoint) with self.websocket.WebsocketTransport( CONF.zaqar.project_id, ks.auth_token, endpoint, queue_name=CONF.zaqar.queue_id) as ws: # FIXME(dprince) would be nice to use message_delete_many but # websockets doesn't support parameters so we can't send 'pop'. # This would allow us to avoid the 'message_delete' below. # data = ws('message_delete_many', # {'queue_name': CONF.zaqar.queue_id, # 'pop': 1}) resp = ws.send('message_list', {'queue_name': CONF.zaqar.queue_id, 'echo': True}) if ('body' in resp and 'messages' in resp['body'] and len(resp['body']['messages']) > 0): # NOTE(dprince) In this case we are checking for queue # messages that arrived before we subscribed. logger.debug('Websocket message_list found...') msg_0 = resp['body']['messages'][0] data = msg_0['body'] ws.send('message_delete', {'queue_name': CONF.zaqar.queue_id, 'message_id': msg_0['id']}) else: # NOTE(dprince) This will block until there is data available # or the socket times out. Because we subscribe to the queue # it will allow us to process data immediately continual # polling. logger.debug('websocket recv()') data = ws.recv()['body'] return data if CONF.zaqar.use_websockets: data = self.get_data_websocket(ks) else: data = self.get_data_wsgi(ks) return [('zaqar', data)]
deleted_lines: zaqarclient=zaqarclient): endpoint = ks.service_catalog.url_for( service_type='messaging', endpoint_type='publicURL') logger.debug('Fetching metadata from %s' % endpoint) conf = { 'auth_opts': { 'backend': 'keystone', 'options': { 'os_auth_token': ks.auth_token, 'os_project_id': CONF.zaqar.project_id } } } zaqar = self.zaqarclient.Client(endpoint, conf=conf, version=1.1) queue = zaqar.queue(CONF.zaqar.queue_id) r = six.next(queue.pop()) return [('zaqar', r.body)]

commit_message:
Fix Inspector grenade: enable devstack plugin once

Add new ironic inspector builder, which disable devstack plugin
because the grenade code in Inspector enables it, and enabling
it twice causes errors.

Also move rest configuration to ironic-inspector-enabled builder.

Change-Id: I733a1cd6d4c843ec4cc870ad78cc1192d55b6e6f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/09/414109/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
name: ironic-inspector-grenade builders: - ironic-vars-early: script: | # export not needed for this as used within ironic-inspector-enabled # We disable the devstack plugin because the grenade code in Inspector # enables it and enabling it twice causes errors. IRONIC_INSPECTOR_DISABLE_DEVSTACK_PLUGIN=1 - ironic-extra-vars: script: | export GRENADE_PLUGINRC+=$'
'"enable_grenade_plugin ironic-inspector https://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-inspector" - builder: export PROJECTS="openstack/python-ironic-inspector-client $PROJECTS" # grenade enables devstack plugin if [[ -z "IRONIC_INSPECTOR_DISABLE_DEVSTACK_PLUGIN" ]] ; then export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"enable_plugin ironic-inspector git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-inspector" fi # Make IPXE configuration consistent between Mitaka and Master export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_IPXE_ENABLED=True" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_INSPECTOR_RAMDISK_ELEMENT=ironic-agent" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_INSPECTOR_MANAGE_FIREWALL=True" - ironic-inspector-grenade - ironic-tempest-plugin - ironic-inspector-enabled

'"IRONIC_IPXE_ENABLED=True" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_INSPECTOR_RAMDISK_ELEMENT=ironic-agent" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_INSPECTOR_MANAGE_FIREWALL=True" export GRENADE_PLUGINRC+=$'
'"enable_grenade_plugin ironic-inspector https://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-inspector" cp devstack-gate/devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh

commit_message:
Heat-agents container: set up trunk repos correctly

I recently hit this error when trying to build the heat-agents container
with trunk repositories:

Error: Package: 1:openstack-puppet-modules-9.3.0-0.20161216011152.8c758d6.el7.centos.noarch (delorean-current)
           Requires: puppet-ec2api

It turns out that the way we set up repositories in the heat-agents
container is different than the way we set up the repositories in
non-containerized developer setups and CI.

This patch makes the trunk repo setup the same as in non-containerized
environments [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/tripleo-ci/blob/996fb4e69d7445abc98b31adbe7afcc99c11df15/scripts/tripleo.sh#L261-L279

Change-Id: I5cabfd4ad8809674ea968cebfcae5da6453e8c1a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/08/411908/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The variables don't make a ton of sense this way, but they are # defined so that the rest of the trunk repository setup can be # exactly taken from tripleo.sh (after removing 'sudo'). This # should help avoid unwanted differences between containerized and # non-containerized trunk software sources. REPO_PREFIX=/etc/yum.repos.d DELOREAN_REPO_URL=http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/current-tripleo/ DELOREAN_REPO_FILE=delorean.repo curl -Lvo $REPO_PREFIX/delorean-deps.repo http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/delorean-deps.repo sed -i -e 's%priority=.*%priority=30%' $REPO_PREFIX/delorean-deps.repo cat $REPO_PREFIX/delorean-deps.repo # Enable last known good RDO Trunk Delorean repository curl -Lvo $REPO_PREFIX/delorean.repo $DELOREAN_REPO_URL/$DELOREAN_REPO_FILE sed -i -e 's%priority=.*%priority=20%' $REPO_PREFIX/delorean.repo cat $REPO_PREFIX/delorean.repo # Enable latest RDO Trunk Delorean repository curl -Lvo $REPO_PREFIX/delorean-current.repo http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/current/delorean.repo sed -i -e 's%priority=.*%priority=10%' $REPO_PREFIX/delorean-current.repo sed -i 's/\[delorean\]/\[delorean-current\]/' $REPO_PREFIX/delorean-current.repo /bin/bash -c "cat <<-EOF>>$REPO_PREFIX/delorean-current.repo includepkgs=diskimage-builder,instack,instack-undercloud,os-apply-config,os-cloud-config,os-collect-config,os-net-config,os-refresh-config,python-tripleoclient,openstack-tripleo-common,openstack-tripleo-heat-templates,openstack-tripleo-image-elements,openstack-tripleo,openstack-tripleo-puppet-elements,openstack-puppet-modules,openstack-tripleo-ui,puppet-* EOF" cat $REPO_PREFIX/delorean-current.repo
deleted_lines: # Install from master curl -L -o /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean.repo \ http://buildlogs.centos.org/centos/7/cloud/x86_64/rdo-trunk-master-tripleo/delorean.repo curl -L -o /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-current.repo \ http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/current/delorean.repo sed -i 's/\[delorean\]/\[delorean-current\]/' /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-current.repo cat << EOF >> /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-current.repo includepkgs=diskimage-builder,instack,instack-undercloud,os-apply-config,os-cloud-config,os-collect-config,os-net-config,os-refresh-config,python-tripleoclient,tripleo-common,openstack-tripleo-heat-templates,openstack-tripleo-image-elements,openstack-tripleo,openstack-tripleo-puppet-elements,openstack-puppet-modules EOF curl -L -o /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-deps.repo \ http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7/delorean-deps.repo

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-10 00:45:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/e7bcd912bc99da04c1cb64b3aa3be381b681d255', 'message': 'WIP use overcloud-full instead of atomic-image

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-02 00:46:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/ea523b582dadc0e99c3ad84d8233ad114583d472', 'message': 'Use overcloud-full instead of atomic-image

This switches to using overcloud-full as the OS image for
containerized compute. It includes the following changes:
- install, enable and start docker, until this change lands
  I1eab2a6de721c8f3c21c7df0019f2d4d1cc3775f

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-04 20:17:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/19eb678d8fe973081148fc64fb24011bb2dca4f4', 'message': 'Use overcloud-full instead of atomic-image

This switches to using overcloud-full as the OS image for
containerized compute. It includes the following changes:
- install docker, until this change lands
  I1eab2a6de721c8f3c21c7df0019f2d4d1cc3775f
- agent image pull has been removed. This avoids a race between docker
  starting and the current call to pull. This relies on "docker run"
  to do the initial pull and leaves open the option of some other
  prefetch mechanism to do the initial pull.
- tweaks to host bind mounts
- removal of commands which only apply to atomic

Change-Id: I2e82634785834a877a4dbdbdcd788a9ac1c14a9d

commit_message:
Use overcloud-full instead of atomic-image

This switches to using overcloud-full as the OS image for
containerized compute. It includes the following changes:
- install docker, until this change lands
  I1eab2a6de721c8f3c21c7df0019f2d4d1cc3775f
- agent image pull has been removed. This avoids a race between docker
  starting and the current call to pull. This relies on "docker run"
  to do the initial pull and leaves open the option of some other
  prefetch mechanism to do the initial pull
- rely on unit Conflicts= to ensure heat-docker-agents and
  os-collect-config do not run at the same time
- tweaks to host bind mounts
- removal of commands which only apply to atomic

Co-Authored-By: Martin Andr <m.andre@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2e82634785834a877a4dbdbdcd788a9ac1c14a9d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/80/395880/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO remove when not required# TODO remove this when built image includes docker if [ ! -f "/usr/bin/docker" ]; then yum -y install docker fi # ensure os-collect-config.service is not running, since it is replaced by # $agent_image systemctl disable os-collect-config systemctl stop os-collect-config systemctl enable docker if [ "$docker_namespace_is_registry" = "True" ]; then/usr/bin/systemctl restart --no-block docker.serviceAGENT_COMMAND_MOUNTS="\ -v /var/lib/etc-data:/var/lib/etc-data \ -v /run:/run \ -v /etc:/host/etc \ -v /var/lib/dhclient:/var/lib/dhclient \ -v /var/lib/cloud:/var/lib/cloud \ -v /var/lib/heat-cfntools:/var/lib/heat-cfntools \ -v /etc/sysconfig/docker:/etc/sysconfig/docker \ -v /usr/lib64/libseccomp.so.2:/usr/lib64/libseccomp.so.2 \ -v /usr/bin/docker:/usr/bin/docker \ -v /var/lib/os-collect-config:/var/lib/os-collect-config"Restart=always ExecStartPre=-/usr/bin/docker rm -f heat-agents ExecStartPre=-/usr/bin/docker pull $agent_image
deleted_lines: /sbin/modprobe ebtables # CentOS sets ptmx to 000. Withoutit being 666, we can't use Cinder volumes chmod 666 /dev/pts/ptmxif [ "$docker_namespace_is_registry" = True ]; then /usr/bin/systemctl stop docker.service /usr/bin/systemctl start --no-block docker.service /usr/bin/docker pull $agent_image & DOCKER_PULL_PID=$!AGENT_COMMAND_MOUNTS="-v /var/lib/etc-data:/var/lib/etc-data \ -v /run:/run \ -v /etc:/host/etc \ -v /usr/bin/atomic:/usr/bin/atomic \ -v /var/lib/dhclient:/var/lib/dhclient \ -v /var/lib/cloud:/var/lib/cloud \ -v /var/lib/heat-cfntools:/var/lib/heat-cfntools \ -v /etc/sysconfig/docker:/etc/sysconfig/docker \ -v /usr/lib64/libseccomp.so.2:/usr/lib64/libseccomp.so.2" # NOTE(flaper87): Some of these commands may not be present depending on the # atomic version. for docker_cmd in docker docker-current docker-latest; do if [ -f "/usr/bin/$docker_cmd" ]; then AGENT_COMMAND_MOUNTS+=" -v /usr/bin/$docker_cmd:/usr/bin/$docker_cmd" fi doneRestart=on-failure ExecStartPre=-/usr/bin/docker kill heat-agents ExecStartPre=-/usr/bin/docker rm heat-agentschmod 0640 /etc/systemd/system/heat-docker-agents.service# Disable NetworkManager and let the ifup/down scripts work properly. /usr/bin/systemctl disable NetworkManager /usr/bin/systemctl stop NetworkManager # Atomic's root partition & logical volume defaults to 3G. In order to launch # larger VMs, we need to enlarge the root logical volume and scale down the # docker_pool logical volume. We are allocating 80% of the disk space for # vm data and the remaining 20% for docker images. ATOMIC_ROOT='/dev/mapper/atomicos-root' ROOT_DEVICE=`pvs -o vg_name,pv_name --no-headings | grep atomicos | awk '{ print $2}'` growpart $( echo "${ROOT_DEVICE}" | sed -r 's/([^0-9]*)([0-9]+)/\1 \2/' ) pvresize "${ROOT_DEVICE}" lvresize -l +80%FREE "${ATOMIC_ROOT}" xfs_growfs "${ATOMIC_ROOT}" cat <<EOF > /etc/sysconfig/docker-storage-setup GROWPART=true AUTO_EXTEND_POOL=yes POOL_AUTOEXTEND_PERCENT=30 POOL_AUTOEXTEND_THRESHOLD=70 EOF

added_lines: Getting Involved ================ Need a feature? Find a bug? Let us know! Contributions are much appreciated and should follow the standard `Gerrit workflow <http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html>`__. - We communicate using the #openstack-kolla irc channel. - File bugs, blueprints, track releases, etc on `Launchpad <https://launchpad.net/kolla-kubernetes>`__. - Attend weekly `meetings <https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Meetings/Kolla>`__. - Contribute `code <https://git.openstack.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes>`__. General Information ===================

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/12/416012/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================================ The kolla-kubernetes deliverable deploys OpenStack on top of Kubernetes. This work is experimental at this time. A 1.0.0 version or later signals this work is ready for evaluation. The kolla-kubernetes RepositoryThe kolla-kubernetes repository is one of three deliverables of the OpenStack Kolla project. The three deliverables that make up the Kolla project are: =============== ===================================================== Deliverable Repository =============== ===================================================== kolla https://git.openstack.org/openstack/kolla kolla-ansible https://git.openstack.org/openstack/kolla-ansible kolla-kubernetes https://git.openstack.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes The kolla deliverable maintains container images and container build tools. The kolla-ansible deliverable maintains an Ansible deployment for Kolla containers on bare metal. THe kolla-kubernetes deliverable maintains a cloud-native implementation of deployment of OpenStack on Kubernetes.
deleted_lines: ===============================Kubernetes deployment of the Kolla containers. Kolla-Kubernetes is a project whose goal is to deploy Kolla's containers with Kubernetes.

commit_message:
objects: add new field cpu_emulator_threads_policy

In order to store the emulator policy requested for an instance, a new
field cpu_emulator_threads_policy has been added to the object
InstanceNUMATopology.

implements blueprint libvirt-emulator-threads-policy

Change-Id: Id0f3726069a00955d32cf394fccc39e2a149e5ca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/22/385022/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class CPUEmulatorThreadsPolicy(BaseNovaEnum): # shared (default): Emulator threads float across the pCPUs # associated to the guest. SHARED = "shared" # isolate: Emulator threads are isolated on a single pCPU. ISOLATE = "isolate" ALL = (SHARED, ISOLATE) class CPUEmulatorThreadsPolicyField(BaseEnumField): AUTO_TYPE = CPUEmulatorThreadsPolicy()

commit_message:
[ipmitool] Do not try powering off nodes that are already off when rebooting

We already have safeguards when processing power on and off requests, but not when rebooting.

Apparently some IPMI implementation (notably, OVB) have occasional problems with it.

Closes-Bug: #1648126
Change-Id: Ib9e2d0379016c64d0b507725e4ac2c2ab4064629

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(sth == None) to assertIsNone(*) or
assertTrue(isinstance(inst, type)) to assertIsInstace(inst, type) or
assertTrue(not sth) to assertFalse(sth).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail.

Change-Id: I8be876e0d2a1ea5d6f8454ca973e2d874d10283d
