[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-02 12:14:09.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_policy/shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy/commit/9a279cda12f723f8581082797fd6f112f02bbeaa', 'message': "Remove dead code and use default value of argparse.

In the 'tool' method, the var 'apply_rule' was tested, and the
method returned if it was true. Then, it was tested again even
though it could only be 'false' (or not be None).
Also, an unused parameter of main() had been removed.

Closes-Bug #1650599
Signed-off-by: Sami Makki <mail@samimakki.fr>

Change-Id: Ie7626f0bcc37887ccc940bb029909f92c8834875
"}]
commit_message:
Remove dead code and use default value of argparse.

In the 'tool' method, the var 'apply_rule' was tested, and the
method returned if it was true. Then, it was tested again even
though it could only be 'false' (or not be None).
Also, an unused parameter of main() had been removed.

Closes-Bug #1650599
Signed-off-by: Sami Makki <mail@samimakki.fr>

Change-Id: Ie7626f0bcc37887ccc940bb029909f92c8834875
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy refs/changes/40/416040/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _try_rule(key, rule, target, access_data, o) def main(): tool(args.policy, args.access, args.rule, is_admin) sys.exit(main())
deleted_lines: if apply_rule: if (apply_rule == key): _try_rule(key, rule, target, access_data, o) else: _try_rule(key, rule, target, access_data, o) def main(argv=sys.argv[1:]): apply_rule = args.rule except Exception: apply_rule = None try: tool(args.policy, args.access, apply_rule, is_admin) sys.exit(main(sys.argv[1:]))

added_lines: --- features: - Enhance pci.passthrough_whitelist to support regular expression syntax. The 'address' field can be regular expression syntax e.g. {"address":{ "domain": <regex_domain>, "bus": <regex_bus>, "slot": <regex_slot>, "function": <regex_function> }} The old pci.passthrough_whitelist, glob sytnax, is still valid config.

commit_message:
devstack: support the gnocchi collector

Actually use CLOUDKITTY_COLLECTOR to setup the ceilometer/gnocchi
collectors.

Update the documentation accordingly.

Change-Id: I7308c0597c0ae9dac435cf1c0cc2e3b4c07ba063
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/00/409500/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Add the following lines in your ``local.conf`` file to enable CloudKitty with the ceilometer collector: To enable the gnocchi collector, use the following instead: :: [[local|localrc]] # gnocchi enable_plugin gnocchi https://github.com/openstack/gnocchi master enable_service gnocchi-api,gnocchi-metricd # ceilometer enable_plugin ceilometer https://git.openstack.org/openstack/ceilometer.git master # horizon enable_service horizon # cloudkitty enable_plugin cloudkitty https://git.openstack.org/openstack/cloudkitty.git master enable_service ck-api ck-proc CLOUDKITTY_COLLECTOR=gnocchi Then start devstack:
deleted_lines: The installation of CloudKitty from DevStack is pretty straightforward. Just add the following lines to your local.conf file.Then, you can start devstack.

commit_message:
Fix ordering in the ironic-inspector grenade job definition

With the current ordering, half of the settings is actually ignored,
and the job is doing something completely random (and fails).

Change-Id: I6b7bdaaa1ea94a8b0368371a2976330c24363183

commit_message:
Add aliases for direct publisher

Deprecate the direct publisher in favor of explicit
publisher name like 'gnocchi://', 'database://',
'file://', ...

Change-Id: I11991352e55c7efc2fa808d429075a060fdcd29e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/51/395451/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: gnocchi = ceilometer.publisher.direct:DirectPublisher database = ceilometer.publisher.direct:DirectPublisher file = ceilometer.publisher.direct:DirectPublisher gnocchi = ceilometer.publisher.direct:DirectPublisher database = ceilometer.publisher.direct:DirectPublisher file = ceilometer.publisher.direct:DirectPublisher

commit_message:
Switch main components to transport_url

Messaging rabbit-* parameters are deprecated in upstream, so
this patch switches all main components to usage of transport_url

Change-Id: I042f68ac1aeb14234898711a25eaebe0836cbb90
Partial-Bug: #1477967
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/76/411776/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $rpc_backend = 'rabbit' $transport_url = os_transport_url({ 'transport' => $rpc_backend, 'host' => split($amqp_hosts), 'username' => $amqp_user, 'password' => $amqp_password, # 'virtual_host' => 'virtual_host', # 'ssl' => '1', # 'query' => { 'key' => 'value' }, }) notice "Transport url is ${transport_url}" # rpc_backend => $rpc_backend, # #FIXME(bogdando) we have to split amqp_hosts until all modules synced # rabbit_hosts => split($amqp_hosts, ','), # rabbit_userid => $amqp_user, # rabbit_password => $amqp_password, default_transport_url => $transport_url
deleted_lines: $rpc_backend = 'nova.openstack.common.rpc.impl_kombu' rpc_backend => $rpc_backend, #FIXME(bogdando) we have to split amqp_hosts until all modules synced rabbit_hosts => split($amqp_hosts, ','), rabbit_userid => $amqp_user, rabbit_password => $amqp_password,

commit_message:
Make nova-consoleauth use memcache as cache backend

Now Mirantis OpenStack uses python dictionary's to store
nova-consoleauth tokens and it fails to connect to VNC on
page reload if we use HA cluster, so we need to use
memcache as cache backend.

Change-Id: Ib530c9144d573925d9bc796438485e16e54056df
Closes-Bug: #1576218
(cherry picked from commit fc333aab261e6d255dbf818d2d48ec332f20feb3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/13/415013/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if pick($nova_hash['use_cache'], true) { class { '::nova::cache': enabled => true, backend => 'oslo_cache.memcache_pool', memcache_servers => $memcached_servers, } }

commit_message:
add new library "openstackclient" to OSC team

We are proposing a new library "openstackclient" be added to the
OSC's team governance. The new library is different from the
existing "python-openstackclient", it will install all OSC plugins
by default.

Depends-On: I5349e9ab801219b0ed72e817fb1cc980a5240d59
Change-Id: Ia6aabd3e5869eaf2e5f9d242ab5e8c007a3b2a28

commit_message:
Add support for https endpoint in auth URI

Since the 'scheme' for the identity endpoint is defined as a
node attribute, we can use this value when constructing the auth
URI in the tempest.conf

Closes-Bug: #1650364
Change-Id: Ieaadef347661547cb549870e42e2a0d92c722b8e

commit_message:
Fix the wrong command

To remove the floating IP address should be 'floating ip delete'.

Change-Id: I87a1438222661e1cb5177a5329955dcd3fed316b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/49/415949/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $ openstack server remove floating ip INSTANCE_NAME_OR_ID FLOATING_IP_ADDRESS $ openstack floating ip delete FLOATING_IP_ADDRESS
deleted_lines: $ nova floating-ip-disassociate INSTANCE_NAME_OR_ID FLOATING_IP_ADDRESS $ openstack server remove floating ip INSTANCE_NAME_OR_ID FLOATING_IP_ADDRESS

revisions:

commit_message:
Use assertGreater(len(x), 0) instead of assertTrue(len(x) > 0)

assertGreater provides a nicer error message if it fails.

Change-Id: Ib4c20f96d9af63a3c49b4875e550ef1ef42e2527

commit_message:
Refactor out keystoneauth code from neutron

* Split get_neutron_client into three methods: get_neutron_client,
  get_auth_plugin, and get_keystone_session.
* Split register_neutron_opts into two methods:
  register_neutron_opts and register_keystoneauth_opts
* Split list_neutron_opts into two methods: list_neutron_opts
  and get_keystoneauth_conf_options

This allows Fuxi to reuse the keystone code to get a cinder
client and generate sample config.

Change-Id: I9053b6d1a669d471a4c6b447fb72591a421a8caa

commit_message:
Avoid hard-coding of 'neutron' config group

The name of neutron config group is specified in file
kuryr/lib/config.py. If we want to retrieve the name of this config
group, we should read it from that file instead of hard-coding it.

Change-Id: Id6ebc4fc8433a802edc04b941a591e03d23c489e

commit_message:
Python routes update to 2.4.1

Use the latest version. This is due to the fact that 2.3.1
is not found. So the gate is failing for all projects.

Please see https://github.com/bbangert/routes/issues/76

Change-Id: I1f1827a42486e19099b8c83ad22674a74b8db84a

commit_message:
spec on legacy tables clean work

1. What is the problem?
After the Tricircle narrowed its scope to networking automation across Neutron
servers, many table are deprecated, therefore they should be removed. Other
tables that still exist in the Tricircle need to be renamed for better
understanding.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
The detailed description of the problems and the proposals to solve the
problems will be covered in this specification.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
The new features discussed in this specification needs to be implemented.

Change-Id: Idf61ecb30f54e40fde283ee5f3278b2f4b429f66
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/43/412443/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ===================================== Tricircle Table Clean After Splitting ===================================== Background ========== Originally the Tricircle provided unified OpenStack API gateway and networking automation functionality. But now the Tricircle narrows its scope to networking automation across Neutron servers, the functionality of OpenStack API gateway is developed in another project called Trio2o[1]. Problem Description =================== After this splitting, many tables would no longer be used, including quota, volume, aggregate and pod binding, etc. The data models, tables and APIs of them should be removed. As for the rest of the tables that are still in use in the Tricircle, they should be renamed for better understanding. Apart from the table clean work and table rename work, some new features will be developed to remove the dependency on old tables. For example, during the period of external network creation, it will take 'availability_zone_hints' (AZ or az will be used for short for availability zone) as a parameter. Previously az_hints was searched in the pod binding table by az_name and tenant_id, now the pod binding table is deprecated and new search strategy is needed to fix the problem.[2] Proposed Change =============== All tables that need changes can be divided into two categories, ``Table to be removed``, ``Table to be renamed``. Table to be removed: - quality_of_service_specs - quota_classes - quota_usages - quotas - reservations - volume_type_extra_specs - volume_type_projects - volume_types - aggregates - aggregate_metadata - instance_types - instance_type_projects - instance_type_extra_specs - key_pairs - pod_binding Table to be renamed: - cascaded_pod_service_configuration - cascaded_pods - cascaded_pods_resource_routing - job The deprecated tables will be removed from the repository directly, and other tables containing old meanings will be renamed for better understanding. After the deletion of pod binding table, new features will be developed to support the external network creation. Data model impact ================= In database, many tables are removed, other tables are renamed for better understanding. Documentation Impact ==================== After the pod binding table is removed, the explanation of the pod binding API in the doc/source/api_v1.rst will be removed as well. Dependencies ============ None References ========== [1] https://github.com/openstack/trio2o [2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/412325/

Rename 'format_labels' to 'format_args' in OSC

Also, remove the hostname and ports as well, since they are
already removed in client.

commit_message:
[POC][placement] Add 'GET /resource_providers/traits' API

The API 'GET /resource_providers/traits' is used for user to query
which traits are supported in the cloud.

Partial implement blueprint resource-provider-tags

Change-Id: I2afda347b12dd1fcdd94806e38be7967d8244a1e

commit_message:
Use assertGreater() or assertLess()

assertGreater() or assertLess()
will return nicer error if it fails.
So we use assertGreater() or assertLess()
to replace assertTrue()

Change-Id: Ic68e292feac359d8d0053a34d24cb671766fc00a

commit_message:
Federated authentication via ECP functional tests

Adds a first test for the federated authentication feature. It handles
first the authentication using the SAML2 ECP profile.

The tests cleanup have some issues, see related bug.

Related-Bug: 1642692
Change-Id: I3b393a695c6d9f846efdaf302c1beea34e6bd54b

commit_message:
Re-download flows when reconnect to ryu controller

This patch triggers a sync event when ovs reconnect to ryu controller.
This sync event will clear the db_store so that the df controller
will treat all resources as new resources, and thus download flows
for all resources.

Change-Id: I27aedd1fccb334ef9f92f96af79e4d1e7aa56361
Closes-Bug: #1626887

added_lines: def clear(self): for topic in self.tenant_dbs: new_tenant_db = TenantDbStore() new_tenant_db.publishers = self.tenant_dbs[topic].publishers self.tenant_dbs[topic] = new_tenant_db

commit_message:
[PoC][placement] Integrate with os-traits library

Integrate with os-traits library. To check the conflict with
standard traits in the CRUD operation of Trait/TraitList object.

Change-Id: If8274e198947841557815461af90d70751b0b8cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/82/377382/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_check_traits(self): traits = set(["hw:cpu:x86:sse42", "hw:cpu:x86:xop"]) not_traits = set(["not_trait1", "not_trait2"]) check_traits = [] check_traits.extend(traits) check_traits.extend(not_traits) self.assertEqual((traits, not_traits), ot.check_traits(check_traits))

commit_message:
Trivial: fix typos about stringify

This patch fixes typos in the name of function. "stingify_xyz"
should be "stringify_xyz".

Change-Id: I0edb8b6486a65fa0d379df06ae92e9a5409d6f51

commit_message:
Remove the temporary flag "rpc_use_object" in config.py

This patch removes the temporary flag "rpc_us_object" in config.py,
also modifies the related code.

Change-Id: I7233335cb9f98cee56c135ba4cedaeff866fcc5a

commit_message:
Expand Feature Classification Advanced Features

Dependent patch to add more core network features
to the existing framework.

feature_matrix_af: Advanced Features.
Which includes items such as qos, quotas, l3-ha.

Other patches will build upon the parent patchset
and build out the other matrices.

Change-Id: I272971de090b110c7c86e0039349abb795348d7d

added_lines: [operation.subnetpools-extension] title=Subnet Pools Extension notes=Subnet pools manage the address pool from which subnets can be allocated. Ensures no overlap between any subnets allocated from the same pool. maturity=complete api_doc_link=http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/#subnet-pools-extension-subnetpools admin_doc_link=http://docs.openstack.org/draft/networking-guide/config-subnet-pools.html tempest_test_uuids=62595970-ab1c-4b7f-8fcc-fddfe55e9811 vmware-ci=complete opendaylight-ci=missing mellanox-ci=complete hyperv-ci=complete intel-nfv=unknown intel-sriov=unknown [operation.quotas] title=Quotas notes=Quotas limit the number of available resources. Default quotas are enforced for all tenants. Admins can update and modify quotas to match their needs. maturity=complete api_doc_link=http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/#quotas-extension-quotas admin_doc_link=http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/cli-networking-advanced-quotas.html tempest_test_uuids=2390f766-836d-40ef-9aeb-e810d78207fb vmware-ci=complete opendaylight-ci=unknown mellanox-ci=complete hyperv-ci=complete intel-nfv=complete intel-sriov=complete [operation.tags] title=Tags Extension notes=Tag service plugin allows users to set tags on their resources. Tagging resources can be used by external systems or any other clients of the Neutron API. maturity=complete api_doc_link=developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/#tag-extension-tags admin_doc_link=http://docs.openstack.org/draft/networking-guide/ops-resource-tags.html tempest_test_uuids= vmware-ci=complete opendaylight-ci=unknown mellanox-ci=complete hyperv-ci=complete intel-nfv=complete intel-sriov=complete [operation.network-ip-availability] title=Network IP Availability notes=Ability to check IP usage stats for all networks and subnets. maturity=complete api_doc_link=http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/#network-ip-availability-and-usage-stats admin_doc_link=http://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron/devref/network_ip_availability.html tempest_test_uuids= vmware-ci=complete opendaylight-ci=missing mellanox-ci=complete hyperv-ci=complete intel-nfv=complete intel-sriov=complete [operation.qos] title=Quality of Service notes=Ability to guarantee certain network requirements like bandwidth, latency, reliability. Network devices like switches and routers handle traffic to fulfill QoS conditions. maturity=complete api_doc_link=http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/#qos-policies-qos admin_doc_link=http://docs.openstack.org/draft/networking-guide/config-qos.html tempest_test_uuids= vmware-ci=complete opendaylight-ci=complete mellanox-ci=complete hyperv-ci=complete intel-nfv=complete intel-sriov=complete [operation.multiple-provider-extension] title=Multiple Provider Extension notes=Enables admins to define multiple physical bindings for a network. The attributes are provider: network_type, physical_network and segmentation_id maturity=experimental api_doc_link=http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/#show-network-details-provider-network admin_doc_link=http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/networking-adv-features.html#provider-attributes vmware-ci=complete opendaylight-ci=missing mellanox-ci=complete hyperv-ci=unknown intel-nfv=unknown intel-sriov=unknown

commit_message:
Expand Feature Classification Advanced Services

Dependent patch to add more core network features to
the existing framework.

feature_matrix_nas: Networking Advanced Services.
Which includes items such as lbaas, fwaas, etc..

Other patches will build upon the parent patchset and build out the
other matrices.

Partial-Bug: #1580327

Change-Id: Ifa27ac9ebaa4ad6a08623c129ace161984ea1deb

commit_message:
Expand Feature Classification General Features

Dependent patch to add more core network features to the
existing framework.

feature_matrix_gp: General Purpose networking features.
Which includes items such as create network, create subnet, etc..

Other patches will build upon the parent patchset and build out the
other matrices.

Change-Id: I21da64dfe7a4fa1efa4147abc6b14185842f09d1

commit_message:
Fix get all attributes with cache data

Fix Stack.cache_data_resource_all_attributes to use the proper key in
the cache data to retrieve all attributes. It didn't manage to properly
test the fix, because cache data is volatile, but it's clearly using the
wrong key.

Change-Id: Ia143c1debc806fcdc785c4dfea03db21c5e66f2b
Closes-Bug: #1637137

commit_message:
Spec to support service status reporting

Change-Id: Ie6ce07a5525a9a6268137a7ebaec189f8cbb0965
Partially-implements: blueprint services-status
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/95/402395/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. ================= Services Status ================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/dragonflow/+spec/services-status This specs is being introduced, to keep the status of all the services available all the time in database. Problem Description =================== This specs solves the following problem * To view services status in cluster, administrator does not have any tool. This spec enables administrators to view status of the services in the cluster from any node having df-db command available. * Other services can take advantage of services status to schedule tasks. * It enables administrator to put a node in maintenance mode or stop a service from participating in processing. * This spec will provide support in future, for making services highly available. Proposed Change =============== Make Dragonflow services report its timestamp to Dragonflow Northbound Database periodically. Add common code, which can be used by all the service to report their status. The implementation will be under the assumption that all the nodes in OpenStack cloud have consistent time. Controller needs to report status of following services -> L3 agent -> metadata proxy -> local controller -> publisher service Local controller status is planned to report its status in [#]_ blueprint ..[#] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/385719/ To avoid writing duplicate code, mentioned blueprint's code will be reused for status reporting. A generic module will be written, which takes name of the service as input and does the tasks of reporting status to DB. Therefore L3 agent and metadata proxy service can use the same module. For publisher run with neutron-server process, it could also be managed by ProcessManager and takes the responsibility of reporting status. or The same generic module(used for L3 agent or metadata service) can be used for status of the service. It will resuse existing code and seems to be clean way of doing it. Configuration Changes: ---------------------- Add a new configuration option, *service_down_time* in df section, which means that the service will be considered as down, if it doesn't report itself for such a long time. The default value of *service_down_time* will be 80s which should be at least more than three of *report_interval* described below. Add a new configuration option, *service_report_interval*. Services will report timestamp to Dragonflow Northbound Database by using this option as time interval. The default value of *service_report_interval* is 25 seconds, which should not cause big impact to the performance of Dragonflow Northbound Database. If code of chassis alive and ProcessManager report is used then *service_down_time* and *service_report_interval* will not be applicable for the respective services. NB Data Model Impact -------------------- A new table will be added in Dragonflow NB database, which contains following information regarding each service -> id -> host or chassis # Can be agreed after discussion -> binary or name # Can be agreed after discussion -> disabled -> disabled_reason -> last_seen_up -> forced_down -> report_count Publisher Subscriber Impact --------------------------- Dragonflow controller should silently ignore all the updates on the new table. Dragonflow DB CLI Impact ------------------------ df-db will utility will be provide following commands to the administrator -> service list:- List all the registered services -> service show:- Show detailed information of the service to fetch -> service enable:- Enable an already disabled service -> service disable:- Disable a service Based on *service_down_time* configuration and last_seen_up, disabled field from database decide state of the service. Dragonflow Applications Impact ------------------------------ None Installed flows Impact ---------------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: `rajiv-kumar <https://launchpad.net/~rajiv-kumar>`_ Work Items ---------- -> Make Dragonflow controller silently ignore the changes in service table. -> Add configuration and make Dragonflow services report to Dragonflow Northbound Database periodically. -> Add commands to Dragonflow DB CLI. References ========== https://review.openstack.org/#/c/385719/8/doc/source/specs/support_check_chassis_alive.rst http://docs.openstack.org/developer/dragonflow/specs/publish_subscribe_abstraction.html https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/fuel-specs/specs/6.1/neutron-agents-local-reports.html

commit_message:
Use Routes==2.2 until issue 76 is fixed

Routes 2.3.1 and 2.4.0 packages are not on pypi:

https://github.com/bbangert/routes/issues/76

Until that's fixed let's use the 2.2 package.

Change-Id: Ia85d0aa2dafd8f8b844a59692828c0f00c6969c7
